pullrequest.title: updating head to initial MultiSense SL model, with temporary unsynchronized streams.

content.raw:
Suggest doing `this->rosnode_ = new ros::NodeHandle();` (i.e., no ~) to create a node handle operating in the parent namespace.  Then the leading slashes can be removed without changing where the topics appear in the common case.  Need to test that, as I may be misremembering how namespaces work.

Make sure to check how `this->rosnode_` is used.  E.g., if you're retrieving private params, you may want to create another handle via `"(~)"`.
content.html:
Suggest doing this->rosnode_ = new ros::NodeHandle(); (i.e., no ~) to create a node handle operating in the parent namespace. Then the leading slashes can be removed without changing where the topics appear in the common case. Need to test that, as I may be misremembering how namespaces work.

Make sure to check how this->rosnode_ is used. E.g., if you're retrieving private params, you may want to create another handle via "(~)".

content.raw: Suggest wrapping this call in `if(ros::isInitialized())`.  I.e., don't bother creating the ROS thread if the system plugin hasn't already initialized ROS for us.
content.html: Suggest wrapping this call in if(ros::isInitialized()). I.e., don't bother creating the ROS thread if the system plugin hasn't already initialized ROS for us.

content.raw: Minor: if you're not going to put other logic in here, then I don't think that you need to use the connect and disconnect callbacks.  You can query the ros::Publisher object for its subscriber count via [getNumSubscribers()](http://ros.org/doc/api/roscpp/html/classros_1_1Publisher.html#ad56c8e954020290dcb87cd6bbd330a2b).
content.html: Minor: if you're not going to put other logic in here, then I don't think that you need to use the connect and disconnect callbacks. You can query the ros::Publisher object for its subscriber count via getNumSubscribers().

pull_request.title: updating head to initial MultiSense SL model, with temporary unsynchronized streams.

pullrequest.title: updating head to initial MultiSense SL model, with temporary unsynchronized streams.

content.raw:
Using a leading slash in a topic (or other ROS resource) name prevents namespace push down.  Better to say, in this case, `multisense_sl/status`.  If not in a namespace, the result will be the same.

So as to not delay the 1.2 release, this can be ticketed for later if you prefer.

Btw, this comment applies throughout to other topic names (probably also in other plugins).  I won't comment on them individually.
content.html:
Using a leading slash in a topic (or other ROS resource) name prevents namespace push down. Better to say, in this case, multisense_sl/status. If not in a namespace, the result will be the same.

So as to not delay the 1.2 release, this can be ticketed for later if you prefer.

Btw, this comment applies throughout to other topic names (probably also in other plugins). I won't comment on them individually.

pullrequest.title: updating head to initial MultiSense SL model, with temporary unsynchronized streams.

content.raw:
This looks like a potential race condition: two threads check `ros::isInitialized()`, find it false, then both threads proceed to initialize ROS in parallel.

Can we push initialization of ROS for all ROS-enabled plugins to somewhere that is guaranteed to be run serially during startup?
content.html:
This looks like a potential race condition: two threads check ros::isInitialized(), find it false, then both threads proceed to initialize ROS in parallel.

Can we push initialization of ROS for all ROS-enabled plugins to somewhere that is guaranteed to be run serially during startup?
